title: Front Desk Officer Job at Resource Intermediaries Limited
content:
Resource Intermediaries Limited (RIL) is a professional Managementfirm into all core Human Resource Services such as training, recruiting, manpower outsourcing, payroll management, business process outsourcing and general HR consulting services with over 18 years of industrial experience. We pride ourselves in easing business burdens.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Iyaganku GRA - Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a pleasant Front Desk Representative to undertake all receptionist and clerical duties at the desk of our main entrance. You will be the “face” of the company for all visitors and will be responsible for the first impression we make.
	The ideal candidate will have a friendly and easy going personality while also being very perceptive and disciplined. You should be able to deal with complaints and give accurate information. A customer-oriented approach is essential.
	The goal is to make guests and visitors feel comfortable and valued while on our premises.


Responsibilities


	Keep front desk tidy and presentable with all necessary material (pens, forms, paper etc.)
	Greet and Welcome guest
	Answer questions and address complaints
	Answer all incoming calls and redirect them or keep messages
	Receiveletters, packages etc. and distribute them
	Prepare outgoing mail by drafting correspondence, securing parcels etc.
	Check, sort and forward emails
	Monitor office supplies and place orders when necessary
	Keep updated records and files
	Monitor office expenses and costs
	Take up other duties as assigned (travel arrangements, schedules etc.)


Requirements and Skills


	High School diploma; additional qualifications will be a plus.
	Proven experience as front desk representative, agent or relevant position
	Familiarity with office machines (e.g. fax, printer etc.)
	Knowledge of office management and basic bookkeeping
	Proficient in English (oral and written)
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office (especially Excel and Word)
	Strong communication and people skills
	Good organizational and multi-tasking abilities
	Problem-solving skills
	Customer service orientation.


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: vadisa@resourceintermediaries.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Telesales Agent Job at Oisedotcom Limited
content:
Oisedotcom Limited - We are an e-com business that deals in sales of products ranging across a diverse verities of categories including household equipment, home appliances, vehicle gadgets, phone gadgets, security etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telesales Agent

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking smart and experienced tele sales executives.
	The tele sales executives who specializes in following up on already generated leads to close-up sales via phone calls.
	They call leads provided by the marketing team to ensure they go through with their orders daily.
	The role involves holding a conversation with both potential and returning customers informing them about their orders with us and convincing them to go through with their orders.
	They provide both sales and customer care services handling customer queries in a professional manner.

	Calling potential customers from list of leads already generated by our marketing team.

N130,000 - N140,000 monthly. 

Method of Application

title: Social Media Manager Job at Professional Perfect Solutions
content:
Professional Perfect Solutions is an information technology company poised at building and managing voice solutions aimed at enabling your customers to reach you anywhere. Seasoned software engineers centered at developing customer driven software and integrating already developed software.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Ajao Estate, Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a Digital Marketing Officer to develop and implement digital marketing strategies and campaigns.
	The ideal candidate will have strong digital marketing skills, creativity, and the ability to drive engagement and conversions through various online channels.
	This role requires expertise in digital marketing tools, analytics, and content creation.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies and campaigns to drive brand awareness, traffic, and engagement across digital channels, including websites, social media, email, and search engines.
	Create and curate content for digital marketing initiatives, including blog posts, social media posts, emails, videos, and graphics.
	Manage and optimize digital advertising campaigns, including pay-per-click (PPC) ads, display ads, and social media ads, to achieve campaign objectives and ROI targets.
	Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs), metrics, and analytics data to measure the effectiveness of digital marketing efforts and identify opportunities for improvement.
	Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and audience segmentation to inform digital marketing strategies and tactics.
	Collaborate with internal teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to align digital marketing activities with business goals and objectives.
	Stay updated on digital marketing trends, tools, and best practices to ensure the organization remains competitive in the digital landscape.
	Optimize website content, user experience, and conversion funnels to improve online visibility, traffic, and conversion rates.
	Manage relationships with external vendors, agencies, and partners to support digital marketing initiatives and projects.
	Maintain accurate and organized records of digital marketing activities, budgets, and performance metrics.


Requirements and Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Communications, or related field.
	Proven experience in digital marketing, with a focus on digital strategy, content creation, and campaign management.
	Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, platforms, and tools, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and analytics.
	Creative and analytical mindset, with the ability to develop innovative digital marketing solutions and measure their impact.
	Proficiency in digital marketing software, content management systems (CMS), and analytics tools.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
	Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Adaptability and willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and trends.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in work.
	Integrity and professionalism in representing the organization's brand and values.


Skills Required:


	Digital marketing strategy
	Content creation
	Campaign management
	Analytics
	Market research
	Collaboration
	Adaptability
	Communication
	Attention to detail
	Integrity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Resume to: info@pps.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Sales and Distribution Agent Job at SunFi Technology Solutions Limited
content:
SunFi.co is leveraging its leadership experience as a Distributed Energy Provider (DEP) to build a Clean Energy FinTech platform that helps consumers access the most trusted solar and clean energy solutions that deliver the greatest savings. SunFi collaborates with the best equipment suppliers, installers, and financiers to provide clean energy consumers amazing solar experiences to help catalyze the transition to clean energy across Nigeria and eventually, across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Distribution Agent
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Team: Growth (Embedded Sales & Distribution)
Reports To: Channel Manager (Embedded Sales & Distribution)
Grade Level: Lead

About the Role


	SunFi Distributor Agent will be responsible for the direct distribution and sales of solar systems to shop owners, ensuring they understand the product's features, benefits, and payment terms.
	The role involves engaging with shop owners, facilitating supplier credit documentation, closing sales, and ensuring timely payment collection.
	Agents will also be responsible for maintaining a proper sales record, monitoring stock turnover, and ensuring compliance with SunFi’s pricing policy.
	The Agent will actively engage existing solar business owners and companies in the community, educating them on SunFi’s value proposition—not as a competitor, but as a financing partner that enables their customers to access flexible payment plans when purchasing solar systems.
	Additionally, the Dealer will promote SunFi’s subsidized pricing for batteries, inverters, and solar panels from OEMs, while highlighting the opportunity to earn up to a 3% rebate based on sales volume.
	This role requires a proactive, business-savvy leader with strong relationship management skills, sales expertise, and the ability to drive large-scale adoption of SunFi’s solar financing solutions.


Job Responsibilities
Sales & Distribution:


	Receive and safely warehouse units of the Itel 600W solar system from SunFi.
	Physically visit at least six (6) shop owners daily to educate them on the product.
	Secure at least three (3) shop owners daily who agree to take the system on supplier credit and commit to full payment within two weeks.
	Monitor shop owners' sales progress and assist in promoting the product.


Sales Documentation & KYC Compliance:


	Collect and verify KYC documentation for shop owners receiving the system on supplier credit, including:
	Full Name
	Email Address
	Phone Number
	Home & Shop Address
	NIN Slip or Any Valid National ID
	Picture of the Shop Owner in their Shop
	Ensure shop owners sign the SunFi sales agreement before product delivery.
	Submit completed KYC documents to SunFi for approval.


Payment Collection & Order Management:


	Ensure shop owners make full payment of units sold to SunFi’s bank account within two (2) weeks.
	Track and confirm payments made by shop owners before new orders are approved.
	Retrieve unsold systems after three (3) weeks if the shop owner has not sold them, ensuring the product remains in good condition.
	Request additional stock only after fully distributing the previous batch.


Daily Reporting & Meetings:


	Attend daily team meetings from 9:00 AM – 10:00 AM (Monday – Friday) to discuss progress, challenges, and strategies.
	Maintain accurate records of shop owners engaged, deals closed, and payments collected.
	Provide weekly reports on sales performance, customer feedback, and market insights.


Additional Incentives:


	If an Agent/Dealer sells above the recommended retail price, SunFi will refund the extra profit margin.
	High-performing Agents/Dealers may qualify for higher product allocations and exclusive dealer privileges.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND qualification with 2 - 5 years of work experience.
	Sales Experience: Prior experience in direct sales, retail, or solar product distribution is an advantage.
	Communication Skills: Strong ability to engage, educate, and persuade shop owners.
	Negotiation Skills: Ability to close deals and build long-term relationships with shop owners.
	Self-Motivation & Accountability: Ability to work independently, meet daily targets, and maintain proper records.
	Integrity & Reliability: Must be trustworthy and adhere to SunFi’s guidelines and policies.
	Basic Tech Skills: Ability to use a smartphone for record-keeping and communication.


Salary
N75,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume and Application to: careers@sunfi.co using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Administrative Officer Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Zaria, Kaduna / Obajana, Kogi 

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Administrative Officer for CNG Station plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of compressed natural gas stations.
	This position is responsible for managing administrative tasks, supporting station staff, and coordinating activities related to the efficient functioning of CNG stations.


Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Assist in the management and operational support for CNG stations
	Oversee daily administrative functions at the station
	Maintain accurate records for CNG sales, inventory, and fuel usage
	Coordinate with suppliers and service providers for necessary supplies and maintenance
	Address and resolve any operational issues that arise at the stations
	Prepare reports on station performance, inventory levels, and operational expenses
	Ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations
	Assist in scheduling and training staff for effective operation
	Maintain effective communication with upper management and other departments


Requirements


	BSc/BA in Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in an administrative role, preferably in the energy or transportation sector
	Proficient in MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and relevant software applications
	Knowledge of safety and regulatory procedures in the CNG industry is preferred
	Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail


Skills and Behaviors:


	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team
	Adaptability to changing conditions and priorities
	Strong leadership qualities and interpersonal skills
	Commitment to achieving goals and continuous improvement.
